title: Nantucket Is the Priciest Vacation-Home Spot in U.S.
text:
Nantucket Island, Massachusetts is the most expensive vacation-home county in the U.S.

Text size

Nantucket, Massachusetts, is the most expensive vacation-home county in the U.S., according to a report by the National Association of Realtors (NAR) out Thursday.

In the county, which consists of three small islands including Nantucket, Tuckernuck and Muskeget, 55.5% of homes are vacation homes. And the median sales price was over $1 million in 2018.

Both figures were the highest across the 206 vacation counties included in 2019 U.S. Vacation Home Counties Report.

“Some people may visualize the common popular vacation destinations in the U.S. when considering a vacation home, such as counties in Florida or California,” Lawrence Yun, NAR’s chief economist, said in the report. “And although those locations have their share of vacation properties, we see that some homeowners prefer some of the other counties, including those in Massachusetts and New Jersey.”

More: 63-acre "Swain’s Neck” in Nantucket, Mass. Sells for $25 Million

Vacation counties are those with at least 20% of homes for seasonal, recreational and occasional-only use. They accounted for 6.6% of all 3,141 counties in the U.S., according to the NAR, citing data from the Census Bureau.

Other counties with the highest concentration of vacation homes are Dukes County, Massachusetts (55.5%), which includes Martha’s Vineyard; Cape May, New Jersey (50.6%); PitkinCo unty, Colorado (50.6%), which includes Aspen; and Jackson County, Colorado (50.6%).

Additionally, Pitkin ranks the second most expensive vacation county, with a median sales price of $710,443.

From Penta Hot Springs and Ski Slopes in a Colorado Hideaway

Across 206 vacation counties, the median sales price increased 36% from 2013 to 2018, compared to the national average pace of a 31% increase, according to the report.

The strong vacation home markets mainly benefited from the increase in family wealth and low mortgage interest rate, the report said. In 2018, the U.S. household net worth reached an all-time high of $100.3 trillion.

“Some of this tremendous growth in wealth, although concentrated, increased demand for vacation homes,” Mr. Yun said.

This article originally appeared in Mansion Global.
description: The median sales price of homes in the Massachusetts county was above $1 million
